page.title: 10Peats, Kinbrace
page.content: There are a number of peat bogs in the area. Peat,a form of turf, is used as fuel.The top layer is removed by a flaughter spade.Then a peat knife is used to cut the peat into big rectangles.While somebody cuts the peats someone else spreads them on the bank.When the peats are dry on one side you turn them round and stack them up against each other. When the other side is dry they are ready to be taken home. Work starts in the spring when the frost is out of the ground. As there are not many trees around most people rely on peat for their fuel. Peat is also used for growing plants. Eighteen kilometres from Kinbrace there is a peat processing factory which supplies horticultural and agricultural peat.
